I will not recommend this company.  I was not using this for a few months as we no longer needed it. I just checked my bank statement and I  have been charged around Â£90 per month for not using the account. Â£10 for the useless machine rental and Â£75 for non-compliance fee. I phoned them to request to cancel the account and I was told I need to do this in writing and they will charge Â£75 for restocking the useless card machine. I will never use this company again. I do not recommend this company to anyone. The online dashboard is outdated. Their monthly statement does not simply show how much you are being charged.  Outdated card machine, outdated dashboard,  inefficient complaints requirement, huge, surprising fees, and a penalty for closing the account.  there are many companies that do not do any of these. 

I have used a different company in the past. There are no extra fees for the card machine, no compliance requirement or theft of Â£75 per month for not filing the compliance form, and a great online user interface.

I've been a customer of Global Payments for probably a few decades (via HSBC) and have always been very happy with the service I've received so it is with a degree of regret that I find myself needing to resort to Trust Pilot, in order to get my message across to the team at Global Payments UK. I should start by saying that this isn't 1 star review, because I have just spoken to an incredibly helpful, professional and courteous customer service advisor about my issue. But my issue goes beyond what they were able to help with, so it's a 2 star in the hope that my message will still get noticed. Here goes..

What on earth is Global Payments doing, by partnering up with a company which is essentially a loan shark, such as Liberis.com !? I received an email from Global Payments offering a "funding solution" which basically involves receiving a loan which is repaid by deductions from your card payment takings. Sounds convenient and a great facility to take advantage of.

Only, upon getting a quote and doing my own calculations, the interest rate works out at approximately 125% per annum! Is this even legal!? What makes it particularly scandalous in my mind is that the interest rate is not actually disclosed because the facility is never referred to as a "loan" but rather an "alternative funding solution". I guess this is how they can get away with it. You would never know what interest rate you were effectively paying unless you worked it out. Extraordinary!

So funding (ie a loan) of Â£3000 would cost over Â£1000 in interest, paid back over just 4 months. This sounds very similar to the practices that were taken advantage of by the Payday Loan industry some years ago that I understand was finally clamped down on by the FCA. I guess the same protections don't exist for businesses, that exist for individuals.

My big concern though is that it is being championed by the well respected brand that is Global Payments. If I had received the email from Liberis (who I'd never heard of) I would have been more skeptical and not been suprised that it was a very bad deal, but because the email actually came from Global Payments and not Liberis (the customer service advisor I spoke to was able to confirm that the email from Global Payments was legitimate), I trusted the offer.

This experience has entirely undermined and sullied my trust in Global Payments. I never imagined that they would contact me to endorse a product which is so clearly in my mind, a rort.

If you receive any communication from Global Payments regarding Liberis, BEWARE! They are out to trick you. After choosing not to proceed with the application, I then received multiple follow up calls and emails from Liberis, trying to negotiate a better deal which was still over 95% pa in interest.

I hope that Global Payments will see the damage that this partnership with Liberis is doing to their brand and rescind it asap.

Their collective actions resulted in a smooth, stress-free process for setting up my accounts, highlighting the efficiency and client-focused approach of GlobalPay. Itâ€™s refreshing to see such a high level of personal care and attention in the financial services sector.

In conclusion, I would highly recommend GlobalPay for anyone in need of reliable and customer-centric financial services. The outstanding service provided by Ilyas and Adam truly reflects the companyâ€™s commitment to excellence. A big thank you to both of them for their exceptional work and dedication. Their professionalism and ability to deliver under pressure are commendable and greatly appreciated.

We had a customer scam us by falsely initiating a charge back with their card issuer, stating they never received their goods, so GP charged us Â£25 for the privilege, then we defended it with plenty of proof of delivery, photographs GPS coords, GP credited the funds back to us and charged us Â£25 for the privilege, then the scammers card issuer refused the evidence and so GP took their money back again AND charged me Â£25 for the privilege, Â£75 in total and absolutely no defence of my case, they just rolled over and allowed the card issuer to have their way and allowed a criminal to get away with a scam.

GP are profiteering from their customers misfortune and allowing scammers to get away with claiming their money back and keeping their goods, businesses know not to bother defending false, illegal chargebacks as they know the buyer will get their money back AND keep the item they've scammed.

So, I've lost the money from the sale, the products we sent and Â£75 lighter thanks to GP, totally despicable.

We are a profitable business, never had a charge back, rarely have any refunds and bills are always paid by direct debit. This is terrible service.

The speed at which information was provided and dealt with were all excellent. Within a few hours, contract was signed, and delivery of terminal information was shared.

It was a delight to work with James Clegg at Global Payments to help us assist with a request in setting up a new Merchant ID. Would highly recommend him and would hope to work with him again for any future needs.
From my call to them this week, Global Payments have handled my issue promptly and professionally, in particalr Puja who has been very attentive. Excellent customer service. Would recommend.

On a change from the old VISA machines to new Android ones, we were sent 2 machines. We only needed one, so stored the 2nd away. After a week of putting transactions through the new terminal we didn't get any payments. Looking at the receipts to take a photo for a record, and to send them, we noticed that the header was that of another company. The terminal had been sent to us by mistake, and the sales had gone to the company listed as the terminal owner. Complaining about it produced no resolution except for them to collect the wrong terminal. I got a reference number for the complaint and a promise that they would call me back, but have never done so. All calls seem to end up in India and speaking to them, apart from difficulties in understanding them, only produces promises that a senior supervisor would call me back. They never do.
Personally I believe there are better systems out there and I'm currently looking to cancel my contract with Global Payments.

(After a day, I was able to connect without even needing wifi) Then I made the first payment process successfully, but I noticed that the battery of the device was halved even though I fully charged the device the night before. was not happening.

text:
John Moore - Account Manager
What a fantastic experience working with John. He is very knowledgeable about the industry and has made my job a lot easier by explaining what I need to do and without industry jargon. Upon promptly receiving the global payments machines Rob was on hand and extremely efficient at helpfully guiding me through the set up of them and thankfully now we can operate our store with two fully functioning tills that wont drop out of signal.

zero customer care. They dont have any idea of what they do, just reading made up letters not listening.
We pay for zero service.
Changed made without our consent and we had to call and stay on the line ages while each operator once gets tired of our questions pretends to not to hear and the line magically drops. SAD sad non professional team. Feel free to contact me for evidences and all the data i can't publish here, including the ID that i have been asked to remove.

Previously we would take telephone orders and later process them and ring through our 1 physical card terminal. This new system enables the staff to be able to process the order at the time of taking, because they are then all able to use the virtual terminal online to process their card payments.

We now use Global as our website payment gateway too, which has been great to be able to have all our payments now under one roof (previously Opayo).

We are very rural and occasionally have serious problems losing internet or power, and the new terminals have the function to use the built in sim card so we are still able to take payments.

So far our experience has been brilliant and we are very happy :)
